page.title: 20MOOR PARK HOUSE
page.content: Moor Park is a large house standing to the west of Beckwithshaw in its own grounds.It was built in 1859 and many villagers have been employed there in differing capacities over the years.It was bought in the late 1970's by Harrison Developments of Leeds who converted some of the rooms in the house and stable block into flats and others into offices for themselves. During 1983/5 they have stopped reletting flats and have moved tenants from the house into the stable block. This has caused concern in the village as to what will happen.Rumours have included a country club,a restaurant and a squash club with facilities for meals.Nothing has yet been started and villagers are hoping that the house will not be left to deteriorate or be pulled down.
